snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s office has not honored a Freedom of Information request for a video he already screened that pokes fun at his reputation for secretiveness.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo’s office has not honored a Freedom of Information request for an internal video that pokes fun at his reputation for secretiveness; Cuomo ran for office vowing to run the most transparent administration in state history, and his quest to keep the video private is one of the more striking examples of his desire to control information flow, which has emerged as a characteristic of his tenure.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s office has not honored a Freedom of Information request for a video he already screened that pokes fun at his reputation for secretiveness.

headline.seo: Cuomo Now Keeps Comic Video He Screened a Secret
headline.main: Cuomo’s Office Won’t Release 2012 Video Satirizing His Secrecy
headline.print_headline: Cuomo’s Office Won’t Release 2012 Video Satirizing His Secrecy
